snippet: Central Park, the High Line, the Battery and Prospect Park are in the hands of privately held conservancies that raise hundreds of millions of dollars.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column supports proposal from New York State Senator Daniel L Squadron that wealthiest privately held conservancies running New York City's grandest parks, like Central Park and the High Line, tithe 20 percent of the dollars they raise to city's less well-endowed parks; suggests such a move could put as much as $15 million into annual budgets of small parks serving city's poorer populations.
lead_paragraph: Central Park, the High Line, the Battery and Prospect Park are in the hands of privately held conservancies that raise hundreds of millions of dollars.

headline.main: Parks Department Takes a Seat Behind Nonprofit Conservancies
headline.print_headline: City’s Parks Department Takes a Seat Behind Nonprofit Conservancies
